snippet.textDisplay: @Jouhei Kirisagi I think I understand why you dislike it. It's because it's here when the series shifted away from Megami and Shin Megami Tensei. And I agree. However I do like Persona 3, it still had some proper Tensei themes in it, although only a few. For example you actually fought your enemies for real. Everything changed in Persona 4 where you could only fight in the imaginary world.
snippet.textOriginal: @Jouhei Kirisagi I think I understand why you dislike it. It's because it's here when the series shifted away from Megami and Shin Megami Tensei. And I agree. However I do like Persona 3, it still had some proper Tensei themes in it, although only a few. For example you actually fought your enemies for real. Everything changed in Persona 4 where you could only fight in the imaginary world.

snippet.textDisplay: @Robert Simmons Dude. Does arguing fix anything?
snippet.textOriginal: @Robert Simmons Dude. Does arguing fix anything?

snippet.textDisplay:
@CaptainThunderWolf 
i blame myself for giving my immune-suppressed father the pneumonia that killed him. i get the humanity of wanting someone back you feel responsible for killing. 

but having that person who takes that attitude in the answer be yukari is wrong. her whole S-link is about that attitude being wrong; that wallowing in self-pity is the reason her relationship with her mother fell apart; and that she does not want to be that person.

if anything the person most likely to take her attitude is Kirijo. she has lost so much to the dark hour, (Shinjiro, her father, now P3MC) that yukari's reaction would be more understandable. plus her S-link was about acting in her self-interests more than whats good for other people. which would fit her support for bringing P3MC a lot more than Canon Answer
snippet.textOriginal:
@CaptainThunderWolf 
i blame myself for giving my immune-suppressed father the pneumonia that killed him. i get the humanity of wanting someone back you feel responsible for killing. 

but having that person who takes that attitude in the answer be yukari is wrong. her whole S-link is about that attitude being wrong; that wallowing in self-pity is the reason her relationship with her mother fell apart; and that she does not want to be that person.

if anything the person most likely to take her attitude is Kirijo. she has lost so much to the dark hour, (Shinjiro, her father, now P3MC) that yukari's reaction would be more understandable. plus her S-link was about acting in her self-interests more than whats good for other people. which would fit her support for bringing P3MC a lot more than Canon Answer

snippet.textDisplay:
@Robert Simmons
Trust me. It's an understandable reaction. You have somebody watch someone else die, feel like they're responsible... you're just not getting how human it really is.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Robert Simmons
Trust me. It's an understandable reaction. You have somebody watch someone else die, feel like they're responsible... you're just not getting how human it really is.

snippet.textDisplay: @Robert Simmons Is not, bro. You have to understand how she feels, after what she saw. If you think it doesn't make sense, you aren't thinking.
snippet.textOriginal: @Robert Simmons Is not, bro. You have to understand how she feels, after what she saw. If you think it doesn't make sense, you aren't thinking.

snippet.textDisplay: I was at 76 when I fought Nyx and she was a total pushover.  I just had Odin spam Thunder Reign until Nyx switched to something that nulled Zio, and just switched to using Primal Force.  Then I just used Armageddon on Nyx's final form (Death) to avoid all the bullshit with Moonless Gown and Night Queen.
snippet.textOriginal: I was at 76 when I fought Nyx and she was a total pushover.  I just had Odin spam Thunder Reign until Nyx switched to something that nulled Zio, and just switched to using Primal Force.  Then I just used Armageddon on Nyx's final form (Death) to avoid all the bullshit with Moonless Gown and Night Queen.

snippet.textDisplay: The battle for everyone's soul is a remix of the poem for everyone's soul, which is an extension for the velvet room them thing. In other words, yes, it does appear (part of it) in Persona 4.

snippet.textDisplay: I see.. so this song was on your shout-out list THIS early huh? For good reason to. Even in today's standards, the notation in this song strikes a strong chord within me... especially the piano -- in the same manner as KH2's "Fight to the Death."

snippet.textDisplay: When I was playing this game and got to this battle.. and heard the music playing.. i had to litterally turn my speakers up... I never have heard a song so epic for a Final Boss in my fucking life, and it fit every emotion that you were thinking all at once.  But more then anything.. once you heard this song, you KNEW that shit just got real.  And that you were not only staring death in the face, but you were fighting against it.
snippet.textOriginal: When I was playing this game and got to this battle.. and heard the music playing.. i had to litterally turn my speakers up... I never have heard a song so epic for a Final Boss in my fucking life, and it fit every emotion that you were thinking all at once.  But more then anything.. once you heard this song, you KNEW that shit just got real.  And that you were not only staring death in the face, but you were fighting against it.

snippet.textDisplay:
@rpgmaster947 Atlus said, in September I think, that they're working on Persona 5, and that it will use a whole new engine, not that engine used in Catherine. But it won't be out for a while though :(

But! We'll have a Persona fighting game, by Arc System Works, and Persona 4: The Golden on Vita, and a P4 anime, so that'll make that wait less painful right? :)
snippet.textOriginal:
@rpgmaster947 Atlus said, in September I think, that they're working on Persona 5, and that it will use a whole new engine, not that engine used in Catherine. But it won't be out for a while though :(

But! We'll have a Persona fighting game, by Arc System Works, and Persona 4: The Golden on Vita, and a P4 anime, so that'll make that wait less painful right? :)

snippet.textDisplay: @RPGMusicStudios Sorry to be such a ass about this but I believe its underating the game by calling the The Extra story a extra quest. It is all in all a epiloge or even a sequal, but by no means just a "extra" quest. It gives you a sense of understanding of what happened to the characters if you were really into the story, so hearing it being called jut a quest irks me, but I mean no offence to you.
snippet.textOriginal: @RPGMusicStudios Sorry to be such a ass about this but I believe its underating the game by calling the The Extra story a extra quest. It is all in all a epiloge or even a sequal, but by no means just a "extra" quest. It gives you a sense of understanding of what happened to the characters if you were really into the story, so hearing it being called jut a quest irks me, but I mean no offence to you.

snippet.textDisplay:
If you want the original that included the artbook and P3 OST (NA ver. but the JP was more complete), that's sold out unless you go to your local video game specialty store or ebay since ATLUS never reprints stuff. 

Otherwise, there's a ton of copies of P3 FES, which is basically the original with extra content, and a sequel which goes from the conclusion of the original game.
snippet.textOriginal:
If you want the original that included the artbook and P3 OST (NA ver. but the JP was more complete), that's sold out unless you go to your local video game specialty store or ebay since ATLUS never reprints stuff. 

Otherwise, there's a ton of copies of P3 FES, which is basically the original with extra content, and a sequel which goes from the conclusion of the original game.

snippet.textDisplay: Actually, they aren't actually shooting themselves. They're actually using gun-like devices known as "Evokers" in order to summon their Personas to protect them. There's no suicide involved.
snippet.textOriginal: Actually, they aren't actually shooting themselves. They're actually using gun-like devices known as "Evokers" in order to summon their Personas to protect them. There's no suicide involved.
